channel.title: Randomizing numbers
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm working on something and i need a simple code for how to random.
The basic idea is this: Random a number between 0 and 1, meaning picking a random number which is either 0 or 1.
Does anyone know how to do this? I've looked around the forums and got something like [code]Misc.random(20)[/code] I dont know what the right format is etc etc, thanks for reading ;)

item.title: Randomizing numbers
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“swodlayer, post:3, topic:281149”]allright. so practicly, that gives me a random number, BUT

where does it store, in a variable or anything?
how can i make it like:

"Random0-1" + "Agility lvl"
things between the “-” shouldnt be taken litterly :)[/quote]

I think you are saying you want to add a random amount of expierence to a players agility level?

So:

Random generator = new Random();
int someNumber = generator.nextInt(2)
addXp(someNumber, playerAgility);

Read full topic

item.title: Randomizing numbers
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Random generator = new Random(); int someNumber = generator.nextInt(2)

That will gave you a random number from 0 to 1.

Read full topic
